subject: Call for Papers - Computational Approaches to Media Entertainment Research (abstracts by 1-15 November 2019)
body:
Dear Foaad Khosmood,

Media and Communication, an internationally peer-reviewed journal 
indexed in the Web of Science and Scopus (CiteScore: 1.43), is welcoming 
research papers for a thematic issue on "Computational Approaches to 
Media Entertainment Research".

Editors: Johannes Breuer (GESIS—Leibniz Institute for the Social 
Sciences, Germany), Tim Wulf (LMU Munich, Germany) and M. Rohangis 
Mohseni (TU Ilmenau, Germany)

Submission of Abstracts: 1-15 November 2019
Submission of Full Papers: 15-30 March 2020
Publication of the Issue: July/September 2020

https://www.cogitatiopress.com/mediaandcommunication/pages/view/nextissues#MediaEntertainment

As we believe that this issue fits your research interests, would you be 
interested in submitting an article?

All articles published in this issue will be free to download by any 
reader anywhere in the world. To cover its costs, the journal has an 
article processing charge of EUR 900 per published paper, but this is a 
cost that we do not wish authors to personally cover. We advise all 
interested authors to check with their universities if an open access 
fund is available. Authors affiliated with Cogitatio's Institutional 
Members do not incur any publication fees: 
http://www.cogitatiopress.com/mediaandcommunication/pages/view/institutionalmembers

I thank you for your attention and look forward to knowing if you are 
interested in submitting an abstract to this issue.

Best regards,
Raquel

Raquel Silva
Media and Communication
Cogitatio Press
1070-129 Lisbon, Portugal
www.cogitatiopress.com/mediaandcommunication
